clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Analgesia Based Sedation Protocol on Brain Function of Critical Care Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Benzodiazepines is a commonly uesd sedative medication,there are many reports that Benzodiazepines is associated with delirium ,but using of analgesia reduces benzodiazepines requirements .The purpose of this study is to determine whether analgesia based sedation protocol reduces the incident of delirium.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence and duration of delirium in patients with different regimens

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to ICU to weaning,about 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Analgesic level、sedation level、brain function、 blood perfusion for peripheral and brain circulation、sleep stages and variation of blood volume

secondary_outcome.measure: Infusion velocity and total dose of sedative drugs in different groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to ICU to extubation or drug withdrawal,about 7 days
Every 6 hours during the next ICU day
Seven days after giving midazolam to patient

arm_group.description: Remifentanil 1µg/kg/hr intravenous pump and Midazolam loading dose 0.05mg/kg followed by 0.02~0.1mg/kg/h continuous intravenous pump for 7days or extubation
